mods.note: © PORT DIRECTORATE I BASRAH \ HXs/Y# 15/5/ y .94 9 Offi cer Commanding, L. T. ,f Nearch^IS ,, . \ The Politi cal Agent , Muscat. Dear Sir, I thank you for your assistance and cooperation in connection with the survey we have just carried out at Ras-al-Hadd. A landing was not made at Ras-al-Junaiz owing to unsuitable weather conditions and in respect of the Sultans advice. Mr. Logsdale also wishes to convey his thanks to you. Your’s faithfully■■■■■■■■■■■■■■Itmmm & No. 8/9A/49) BRITISH CONSULATE, MUSCAT. May 14, 1949. My dear friend, Will Your Highness kindly refer to your letter of the 12th May ragarding visit of Nearchus to Has al Hadd ? 2. The Commander of L.T. ,, NBARCHUS ,, reports af follows *- n Has al Hadd inadequate for light no elevation. Contacted villagers, most hospitable and helpful. Informed Has al Junaiz uninhabited. Kindly request His Highness consent to landing in view of villagers ; friendliness. Anchored pending urgent reply'. 3. I she'll be grateful for Your Highness* views on the matter. In view of the obvious importance to shipping of a light on Ras al Junaiz I venture to hope you will consider the matter favourably. Your Highness* sincere friend His Highness Saiyid Said bin Taimur, Sultan of 'uscat and Oman, ^— MUSCAT. ATT-Vi: Enquiry respecting this telegram should be accompanied by this form and may be made at any of the Company’s offices - ■■■■■■■■■■■■■— - —- 1 > Ml ■ S’) €> Telegram From To En Clair Commander, Nearchus (YIAJ) Political Agent, Muscat. Dated the 10th and received 11th May, 1949. f ’ Anticipate arrival Muscat eleventh rorning. COMMANDER AA, —4 0 Telegram From To No. En Clair Political Agent, Muscat. Political Resident, Bahrain. 82 Dated the 8th May, 1949. PRIORITY Your telegram 07403. 2. Coast considered unsafe and Sultan is therefore unable to agree to visit at present. POLITICAL AA mmmmNo. 209 / 5 -SM 3 MINISTRY FOR FOREIGN AFFAIRS, MUSCAT 7th. May 1949. Subject* Proposed visit of the 'Nearchus 1 * to Ras A1 Junaiz. Sir, I have the honour to refer to your letter Ho.2/9/7/49, datad the 5th. May 1949, and to say that the coast in question is not regarded as sufficiently safe to enable the Sultan to agree to such a visit at present. The 'Nearchus' should not therefore carry out the proposed survey. I have the honour to be Sir, Your obedient servant, R.E.Ellison Esq., His Britannic Majesty's Consul, Muscat.'s A UR (SENT No.2/9/7/49. British Consulate, MUSCAT. May 5 , 1949. Sir, I have the honour to inform you that His Excellency the Political Resident reports that the n Nearchus ” proposes to visit Ras al Junaiz about 7 miles south of Ras al Hadd about May 10th for q. preliminary survey of site for flight-house. I shall be grateful if you will kindly confirm that the Muscat Government has no objection to the visit and that the local authorities also may be warned that they will have no objection to the subsequent erection of a light-house. The M Nearchus” will call here enroute to take any letter to the local authorities at Ras al Junaiz. I have the honour to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant, The Minister of Foreign Affairs,* H.M*s Consul^ Muscat. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/20 Light House at Rass-al-Hadd and Ras-al-Junaiz'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 15, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning a preliminary survey of Ras al-Hadd and Ras al-Junaiz as potential lighthouse sites. The papers mostly cover the effort to obtain permission for the surveys from the Sultan of Muscat and Oman. Correspondence comes from: the Political Agent, Muscat; Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; the Port Directorate, Basrah; Basil Woods Ballard, Minister for Foreign Affairs, Muscat; and Said bin Taimur [Sa‘īd bin Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd], Sultan of Muscat and Oman. The survey is carried out by HMS Nearchus.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
